metadata.Title: CVE-2021-38496 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
During operations on MessageTasks, a task may have been removed while it was still scheduled, resulting in memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.15, Thunderbird < 91.2, Firefox ESR < 91.2, Firefox ESR < 78.15, and Firefox < 93.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-38496` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 93.0+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-geckodriver - 93.0+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-mozsymbols - 93.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '93.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
